Uses of LSPObject in edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
 

Subclasses of LSPObject in edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
 class LSPBooleanOp
          Represents a "boolean-op" as defined in the STARTS 1.0 specification.
 class LSPContentSummary
          Represents an "scontent-summary", as defined in the STARTS 1.0 spec.
 class LSPDoc
          Represents the "doc" element as defined in the STARTS 1.0 specification.
 class LSPField
          Represents a "field" element as described in the STARTS 1.0 specification.
 class LSPFilter
          Represents a "filter", as defined in STARTS 1.0.
 class LSPMetaAttributes
          Represents the "smeta-attributes" element of STARTS 1.0.
 class LSPMetaAttributeSet
          This helper object fits inside the LSPMetaAttributes object, which, as per STARTS 1.0, stores all meta-attributes for a specific source.
 class LSPModifier
          Represents a "modifier" as defined in the STARTS 1.0 specification.
 class LSPProxOp
          Represents a "prox-op" as defined in the STARTS 1.0 specification.
 class LSPQuery
          Represents an "squery", as defined by the STARTS 1.0 specification.
 class LSPRanking
          Represents a "ranking", as defined in STARTS 1.0: one of possibly several criteria for ranking results.
 class LSPResults
          Represents the "sqresults" header, as defined in STARTS 1.0.
 class LSPSortByField
          A representation of the "sort-by-field" header of STARTS 1.0 This header is found inside an LSPQuery, and tells the BackEndLSP what fields should be used for sorting the results.
 class LSPSource
          Represents a "source", as defined in STARTS 1.0.
 class LSPTerm
          Represents a STARTS "term", as described by the specification.
 class LSPValue
          Wraps some kind of value stored in a STARTS header, for example inside the STARTS "term" (LSPTerm).

 LSPObject[] LSPMetaAttributes.getFieldModifierCombinations()
          What field/modifier combinations are supported in the underlying collection

          See the STARTS 1.0 specification for more information about the meanings of these parameters.
